meanings.definition: A doorway, gate, or other entrance, especially a large and imposing one.
meanings.sent1: The ancient castle had grand portals leading to its majestic halls.
meanings.sent2: The front entrance of the palace was adorned with intricate portals.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse peeked through the massive portal, feeling like a tiny explorer.
meanings.sent4: As the gates opened, the portal to the enchanted garden revealed itself.
meanings.sent5: The portal to the magical realm shimmered with an otherworldly light.

meanings.definition: A website or web page providing access or links to other sites.
meanings.sent1: The homepage of the website served as the main portal to various online resources.
meanings.sent2: The online shopping portal displayed a wide range of products for customers to browse.
meanings.sent3: The internet user clicked on the wrong portal and found themselves in a virtual maze.
meanings.sent4: Her blog became the portal through which she shared her thoughts with the world.
meanings.sent5: The educational portal offered students a gateway to valuable learning materials.
